data.title: Opening using context menu starts two copies of VSCode

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.10.0-insider (40fecfaa77f01672e8a147be71f6f7ccb9cf8a12)
- OS Version: Windows 10 AU (1607, 14393.693)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Find folder with code and right click on it
2. Press "Open with Code"

Excepted Result: One VSCode window with folder we selected
Actual Result: Opens two copies of VSCode - one for folder, second is empty

data.title: Can't Install any extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
 Just started with VS Code today. I am not able to install any extensions. Tried opening some C# files, it recommends me to use a C# extension. Clicked on "Install" button, nothing happens.. Its the same case with other extensions.

data.title: FileService.resolveContent() should check for not modified since as first thing
data.body: Looks like every time we resolve the content of a file we first open it to see for the file being binary or not before checking if the file has changed or not. We should always first check for the file not being modified to avoid reads on the file each time the file is opened.

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Ctrl+Shift+P
2.command palette, but the last command is not saved, could we save the last command?

data.title: Go to implementation should show all implementations if there are multiple
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to implementation on a method that has multiple implementations

=> you end up in any of those
=> I would expect all implementations to show up in our peek UI (same as find references)

data.title: error: the internet connection appears to be offline
data.body:
to repro:

1. turn off the network (pretend you are on an airplane)
2. start VS Code
3. wait something like 20min

Result:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/23446654/4454964a-fdfa-11e6-85e6-08deda109464.png)

Expected:
Nothing! Why are we showing this as an Error?  What can the user do here?  We should just eat this message and never show it because there is nothing I can do and if I'm offline I probably know already because I can't browse Facebook (or Stack Overflow).

data.title: Clearing search results - first history item is wrong
data.body:
- Search for "foo"
- Search for "bar"
- Click the 'clear results' button
- Use alt+up to get the last history item

It should be "bar", but it's "foo"

data.title: [json] deprecation warning indicator should be shown under attribute name, not value
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/23445898/c960a0b0-fdf3-11e6-915a-bcb7db7a3c9a.png)

The warning is that 'outDir' is deprecated, so 'outDir' should be underlined. If an attribute isn't recognized, then the attribute is underlined in that case.

data.title: Wrong warning shown for 'node2'
data.body: When I have a launch config with `"type": "node2`, I see this warning on 'node2':`''env.', 'config.' and 'command.' are deprecated, use 'env:', 'config:' and 'command:' instead.'` instead of the expected node2 warning

data.title: add properties to indicates OutputChannel visibility status
data.body:
according to the [vscode doc](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#_a-nameoutputchannelaspan-classcodeitem-id940outputchannelspan) there's only `hide()` and `show()` method but without detecting the status of the outputchannel.

if there's a property indicates the status of the outputpannel that would be nice.

data.title: JSDoc intellisense & highlight not work for properties with hyphen in it
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (40fecfaa77f01672e8a147be71f6f7ccb9cf8a12, 2017-02-27T14:15:13.224Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark|be5invis|1.2.5|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.6|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.18|
|typescript-hero|rbbit|0.12.0|
|language-stylus|sysoev|1.6.0|;

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write some JSDoc `@typedef` that has a property with hyphens;
Ex.
```js
/**
 * @typedef Product
 * @property {string} title
 * @property {boolean} high-top
 */
```
2. Highlight and intellisense don't work.

![Screenshot proving highlight don't work](https://i.gyazo.com/95b8276599aa4f87759fb14edbe08b5c.png)

![Screenshot proving intellisense don't work](https://i.gyazo.com/c702b6f57c9d72a7f978cbe8b25ed020.png)

data.body:

Minibatch: 170, Train Loss: 1.3920311151548874, Train Evaluation Criterion: 0.627906976744186

3. Move the cursor to the end.
4. Because of the size of DEBUG CONSOLE, this will make scrollbar move. And the first several line will not be showed. for example: it can only show 15 lines at a time.

Hope you can understand what I am saying.
Sincerely.

data.title: Cannot find runtime 'node' on PATH.
data.body:
**Version and Extention Information:**

- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|hopscotch|idleberg|0.1.4|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.7.0|

---

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Open VS Code
- Create a "Hello World!" JavaScript Program.
- Run JS program in VS Code Debugger.

**Code Snippets:**
- helloworld.js
`console.log('Hello World.');`

- launch.json
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/helloworld.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        },
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "name": "Attach to Process",
            "port": 5858
        }
    ]
}
```

**Self troubleshooting:**
- I tried restarting my PC.
- I tried re-installing VS Code.
- Searched for over an hour on google and GitHub for a solution.

**Images of Issue:**
![vscode_error_02-28-2017_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26099581/23443077/72d6dc62-fdfa-11e6-9870-b5ea2419d85a.PNG)
![vscode_error_02-28-2017_3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26099581/23443086/782a5cf2-fdfa-11e6-9f6b-829be0b2e0a3.PNG)

**Update:**
- I also tried to re-run the debugger with all of my extensions disabled.

data.title: Relax Language First Line Match
data.body:
Fixes #21533

**Bug**
The first line pattern for a language currently requires the entire line to match. This does is different from how tools such as textmate use firstLineMatch

**Fix**
Relax this restriction so that any match is used, even if it only matches part of the line

data.title: copy/paste problems in 1.10
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders 1.10 and Stable 1.9.1
- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. in a markdown file, enter in the following text:

the quick brown fox end-to-end "jumped over the lazy dog" and then fell on his face blah blah blah blah blah bbleeck blah blady blah blah

2. Using 1.9.1, copy and paste the text above into Word, you get this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/23441613/19193354-fdd8-11e6-857f-407d837c6c96.png)

3. Using 1.10, copy and paste the text into word, you get this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/23441618/20c5c7a2-fdd8-11e6-932e-408c2da80b75.png)

Results:
* line break after "-" 
* I don't get proper breaks on some words (note "bbleck" is split middle of the word)

I expect to just have the text pasted...

data.title: Feature Request: Offer to open changelog when an extension is updated

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
With every update to VS Code, users now get a prompt to read the release notes.
It would be nice to have the same feature for extensions. Prompt to read the Changelog (if exists) on every update to the extension

Edit:
Prompt might be a bit much, too many notifications. Instead a "What's new" button or a similar option when clicking on the gear icon would be better

data.title: Main + Code Helper processes take 100% CPU

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce: No idea. Happened suddenly for about 30 minutes, then it fell down to about 15% CPU when doing absolutely nothing (fan is still running).

[Spindump file](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/809242/Spindump.txt) while this was happening. The processes taking about 100% CPU is the main Code process (PID 94417) and one of the Code Helper processes (PID 94444).

Anything else I can send, like a log?
